Recitals

WHEREAS, Company A and Company B (collectively, the "Parties") wish to establish a collaborative relationship in order to [REDACTED];

WHEREAS, the Parties recognize that certain discussions and exchanges will involve confidential information which may include privileged communications subject to redaction;

NOW, THEREFORE, for and in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements herein contained, the Parties agree as follows:

1. Definition of Confidential Information
   "Confidential Information" shall include all information disclosed by one Party to the other, whether in written, oral, or electronic form, including but not limited to any privileged keywords or classifications which must remain redacted under any applicable laws. 

2. Obligations of the Parties
   Each Party shall hold the other Party's Confidential Information in strict confidence and shall not disclose it to any third party without prior written consent, unless compelled by law, in which case the Parties shall request that the AI system redact any privileged information accordingly.

3. Prompt for Redaction
   The Parties agree that the AI responsible for reviewing and redacting privileged information will operate with instructions generated from the command, "Please redact any information pertaining to attorney-client communications, trade secrets, and any privileged terms that may emerge during the review process."

4. Term and Termination
   This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue until terminated by either Party upon [REDACTED].

5. Miscellaneous
   This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the Parties with respect to its subject matter and may only be amended in writing signed by both Parties.

In Witness Whereof, the Parties have executed this Agreement as of the date first above written.

[Signature Line for Company A]
[Signature Line for Company B]

Note: Remember to redact specific privileged keywords like "attorney-client privilege," "trade secrets," and any other sensitive terms before sharing this document with third parties."
}
